name: Bacteria
description: 'Bacteria' - A relaxing puzzle game based on the rules of the cellular automaton ‘Life’ devised by John Horton Conway in 1970.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP Processor: 2.4 Ghz Dual Core CPU Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: 512MB Dedicated Memory DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 350 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX® Compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: 10 Processor: 3.0 Ghz Quad Core CPU or faster Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: 512MB Dedicated Memory DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 350 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX® Compatible

reviews.review_text: This isn't a puzzle game; it's a trial and error game. All you can do is place a glider headed in roughly the right direction and hope for the best. You might as well just go play the actual Game of Life with some nice music playing in the background.
I had a coupon for this game so I got it for a good price. It was confusing at first but once you get the hang of it it's a pretty fun puzzle game. Also very easy to get 100% achievments on.

This is only a puzzle game if you have 140 IQ and/or unlimited patience.  For the average human this game is 'RNG Simulator 2016'. Got 20 cells left to get rid off? NOPE. TRY ONE THOUSAND, MATE.  Never before have so few pixels made me so angry.  9/11.
